data.title: Wai 2358 W
data.meta_description: wai2358w - Free ebook download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read book online for free. This chapter discusses the rights that are protected by the Treaty of Waitangi in the context of this claim over freshwater and geothermal resources. The claimants argue that under the Treaty, Māori retained rights and interests in these resources, including rights of ownership, governance and stewardship. The Crown argues a more narrow interpretation, that the Treaty guaranteed Māori the same rights as other citizens. Previous Waitangi Tribunal reports found that the Treaty did protect broader Māori rights and interests in natural resources like freshwater.
